name: Lobster and Mushroom Alfredo with Zucchini 'Noodles'
ingredients: 2 ounces freshly grated parmesan cheese (1/2 cup)
utensils: Mandolin with wide julienne blade or sharp knife

instructions.en: For Zucchini 'Noodles': Trim the ends off the zucchini. Using the wide julienne blade of a mandolin or a sharp knife, shred the zucchini lengthwise into noodle-like strips. Cut strips to desired length.
Sauté zucchini in 1 tablespoon butter in a non-stick skillet until slightly limp, but not mushy. Season with salt, pepper, and Spicy Seasoning Salt if desired. Keep warm in a serving bowl.
For Alfredo Sauce: Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet; sauté the mushrooms until tender.
Add the cream cheese in small chunks and heat on medium-low heat, stirring until melted and smooth. Gradually blend in the cream until smooth.
Stir in the parmesan, pepper, garlic powder, and salt. Cook and stir over low heat until smooth and creamy, thinning with water as needed to make the sauce thick but pourable.
Add the lobster meat and stir to coat with the sauce and heat through. Add the parsley and adjust the seasonings as needed.
Serve the lobster and mushroom Alfredo sauce over the prepared Zucchini 'Noodles'.

notes: Do not freeze this dish. The zucchini 'noodles' have a texture similar to thick egg noodles. You can adjust the thickness of the Alfredo sauce by adding water if needed.
